summary: An email from Michael Lyon, owner of Lyon Aviation, to an unspecified recipient, forwarding a tip regarding private jet flights he believes were arranged by charter broker Dan Ryan on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein. The tip centers on a specific flight in February 2015 transporting a woman from Boston to St. Thomas, which Lyon found suspicious. He suggests Dan Ryan would have records of passenger names and payment sources for numerous flights to St. Thomas.

connections.description: Michael Lyon asserts that Dan Ryan, as a charter broker, was likely working for Jeffrey Epstein or his representatives for many years to arrange private jet flights.
Lyon Aviation performed a charter flight on behalf of charter broker Dan Ryan in February 2015.
Lyon had worked with Customs Agent Mark Cesleone in the past and provided him with a tip about the suspicious flight in 2015.

events.title: Suspicious private jet flight to St. Thomas
events.description: Lyon Aviation transported a lone woman from Boston to St. Thomas on a private jet. The woman was later questioned for hours by St. Thomas Customs upon return on February 10, 2015, and was found to be an escort, not drug-related.

keyFacts: Michael Lyon, an aviation company owner, provided a tip suggesting charter broker Dan Ryan arranged numerous private jet flights to St. Thomas on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein.
A specific flight on February 7, 2015, transported a lone woman from Boston to St. Thomas; she was questioned as a suspected drug courier but was identified as an escort.
Lyon states that Dan Ryan would likely have passenger names and payment source information for these flights, which originated from various parts of the USA, with Los Angeles being a frequent route.
The tip was forwarded via email on July 7, 2020, indicating ongoing interest or investigation into Epstein's travel networks after his death.
